ArticleTitle.sentence: Helicobacter pylori Virulence and Genetic Geography

AbstractText.sentence: Isolated for the first time in 1982 from human gastric biopsy , Helicobacter pylori is responsible for gastritis , peptic ulcer , and gastric cancer .
A pathogenicity island acquired by horizontal transfer , coding for a type IV secretion system , is a major determinant of virulence .
The infection is now treated with antibiotics , and vaccines are in preparation .
The geographic distribution suggests coevolution of man and Helicobacter pylori .
